Dangerous goods are articles or subtances which are capable of posing a significant risk to health, safety or to property when transported by air.

Explosives (substances that are not explosives but which can form explosive atmospheres gas, vapor or dust are not included in class 1). Except which is too dangerous for transportation or place of dominant danger in accordance with other classes. Explosives, except devices containing explosives in such quantities or characters, so that accidental or accidental ignition or initiation during transport will have no external effects either through projection, fire, smoke, heat or loud noise. Class 1 has the following divisions:

Gas is a substance that At 50°\ C has a vapor pressure of more than 300 kPa or has actually become gas at 20°\ C at a normal pressure of 101.3 kPa. The gas sent can be: 

 				 1. Compressed gas 
 				 2. The liquefied gas 
 				 3. Gas cooled 
 				 4. The dissolved gas 
 				 5. Solidified gas 

 There are 3 Division of Gasses :
The purpose of flammable liquid is flammable liquid and this class has no sub-division, but has its own characteristics and specific packing levels, as follows: \n\n

In class 4 it discusses about dangerous and flammable solid-shaped items. Class 4 is divided into 3 divisions. Packing Group Criteria: 

 				 - PG 1: If the substance reacts with water strongly at ambient temperature and generally indicates a tendency for the gas to be produced to spontaneously ignite, or that reacts readily with water at room temperature so that the rate of evolution of flammable gases is equal to or greater than 10 l/kg Substance for one minute. 
 				 - PG 2: If a substance / goods reacts to liquids / water with evolution greater than 20 l/kg hour and does not satisfy PG 1 or PG 2 criteria. 
 				 - PG 3: If a substance or substance reacts slowly to liquid or water and the reaction is less than 1 l/kg hourly and does not meet critically PG 1 or PG 2.

In this fifth class explain about substances and peroxide goods that easily produce flammable O2 or increase the risk of fire hazard in contact with other combustible goods. There are two divisions in this class, namely:
This class describes items that contain toxins and formulations that can cause acute health damage and even death at certain concentrations if contaminated by humans.

Radioactive material means any material containing radionuclides where both the activity concentration. These regulations do not apply to any of the following : 

 				 1. Radioactive material implanted or incorporated into a person or live animal for diagnosis or treatment 

 				 2. Radioactive material in or on a person who is to be transported for medical treatment because the person has been subject to accidental or deliberate in take of radioactive material or to contamination, taking into account the necessary radiological protection measure with respect to other passengers and crew, subject to approval by the operator. 

 				 3. Radioactive material in consumer products which have received regulatory approval, following their sale to the end user. 

 				 4. Non-radioactive solid objects with radioactive substances present on any surfaces in quantities not in excess of the limit specified in the definition of contamination

Substances which by chemical action, can cause severe damage when in contact wth living tissue or, in the case of leakage will materially damage or even destroy, other goods or the means of transport. These tabel for packing group Assignment based on Corrosivity :

Articles and substance which, during air transport, present a danger not covered by other classes. Class 9 includes, but is not limited to the following articles and substances : 

 1. Aviation Regulated Solid or Liquid 
 				 Any material which has narcotic, noxious, irritating or other properties such that, in the event of spillage or leakage on aircraft, could cause extreme annoyance or discomfort to crew members so as prevent the correct performance of assigned duties. The materials included under this proper shipping name must not meet any of the definitions for classes 1 through 8. 

 2. Magnetized material 
 				 Any material which, when packed for air transport, has a maximum magnetic field strength sufficient to cause a compass deflection of more than 2 degrees at a distance of 2.1 m from any point on the surface of the assembled package. 

 3. Elevated temperature substance 
 				 Substance that are transported or offered for transport at temperatures equal to or exceeding 100°C in a liquid state or at temperatures equal or exceeding 240°C in a solid state. 

 4. Lithium Batteries 
 				 Cells and batteries , cells and batteries contained in equipment, or cells and batteries packed with equipment containing lithium in any form must be assigned to UN 3090, UN 3091, 3480, or 3481 as appropriate. 

 Miscellaneous Articles and substance : 

 				 1. Asbestos 
 				 2. Capacitors 
 				 3. Carbon dioxide 
 				 4. Consumer commodity 
 				 5. Chemical and first aid kits 
 				 6. Life saving appliance 
 				 7. Vehicle 
 				 8. Zinc dthionite

Has a mass explosion hazard (mass burst is one that affects almost the entire load almost instantaneously). 

 Name : Explosive 
 Cargo IMP code : REX, RCX, RGX, as applicable 
 Symbol Exploding Bomb (Black) – Background Orange

Has a projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard. 

 Name : Explosive 
 Cargo IMP code : REX, RCX, RGX, as applicable 
 Symbol Exploding Bomb (Black) – Background Orange

Has a fire hazard and the danger of minor explosions or minor projection hazards or both, but not the danger of a mass explosion. This division consists of articles and substances that: 

 			 - Generates a large enough heat, or 
 			 - Burning one after the other, producing a small explosion and / or projection effect. 

 Name : Explosive 
 Cargo IMP code : REX, RCX, RGX, as applicable 
 Symbol Exploding Bomb (Black) – Background Orange

The effect is largely limited to this package and no projection of fragments with size or range is large enough to be expected. External fire should not cause an instantaneous burst of almost the entire package contents. 

 Name : Explosive 
 Cargo IMP code : RXB, RXC, RXD, RXE, RXG, RXS as applicable 
 Figures (Black) – Background Orange

Very insensitive material that has a danger of mass explosion. 

 Name : Explosive 
 Cargo IMP code : REX as applicable 
 Figures (Black) – Background Orange

Highly insensitive material that does not have a mass explosion hazard. 

 Name : Explosive 
 Cargo IMP code : REX as applicable 
 Figures (Black) – Background Orange

Gas with 20C and normal pressure 101.3 kPa. 

 Name : Flammable Gas 
 Cargo IMP Code : RFG 
 Symbol Flame (Black or White) Background Red

- Gases that can cause shortness of breath in the form of liquid gas and can replace the function of air in the atmosphere 
 - Is an oxidizer, a gas which generally can provide oxygen, cause or contribute to the burning of other materials more than air. 

 Name : Non-Flammable Gas, non Toxic Gas 
 Cargo IMP Code : RNG or RCL for Cyrogenic Liquids 
 Symbol Gas Cylinder (Black or White) Background Green

- Known to be highly toxic or corrosive to humans to pose a health hazard 
 - Considered to be toxic or corrosive to humans because it has a value equal to or less than 5000 ml/m3 when tested. 

 Name : Toxic Gas 
 Cargo IMP Code : RPG 
 Symbol Skull and Crossbone (Black) Background White

Name : Flammable Liquids 
 Cargo IMP Code : RFL 
 Symbol Flame (Black or white) Background Red

Flammable solid self reactive substance. This division explains about solids that can be activated or burned on their own which can threaten flight safety. An example of this class is matches. 

 Name : Flammable Solid 
 Cargo IMP Code : RFS 
 Symbol Flame (Black) White with seven vertical red stripes

Substance liable to spontaneous combustion. This division explains about solids that can be activated or burned on their own when in the open air. Examples of substances from this class are Magnesium diamide. 

 Name : Spontaneously Combustible 
 Cargo IMP Code : RSC 
 Symbol Flame (Black) Upper half white lower half red

Substance dangerous when wet. This division explains about solids that can be activated and burned on their own if they have water. An example of this class is carbide. 

 Name : Dangerous When Wet 
 Cargo IMP Code : RFW 
 Symbol Flame (Black or white) Blue

Oxidizer is a substance that easily oxidizes with other substances. An example of this substance is bleaches (bleach). 

 Name : Oxidizer 
 Cargo IMP Code : ROX 
 Symbol Flame over Cycle (Black) Background Yellow

Organic peroxides are goods or substances made from a combination of two oxygen and oxygen structures. It may assist or facilitate the combustion process if exposure to fire or heat can result in an explosion. If it reacts with other materials then the danger will be greater, the decomposition of this material can produce toxic and combustible gas. 

 Name : Organic Peroxide 
 Cargo IMP Code : ROP 
 Symbol Flame (Black or white) Background Upper half red, lower half yellow

Toxic substance is a toxic substance that can cause danger even to death for humans if contacted through swallowing, touching, or inhalation. Division 6.1 has a hazard classified as follows: 

 Name : Toxic 
 Cargo IMP Code RPB 
 Symbol Skull and Crossbone Black background White

This division describes items that are easily infected by pantogen and other organism' s micro content and can cause death to living things. Examples of this class are viruses, and bacteria. 

 Name : Infectious Substance 
 Cargo IMP Code RIS 
 Symbol Three Crescents superimposed on a circle and inscription Black Background White

Name : Radioactive 
 Cargo IMP Code : RRW 
 Minimum dimensions : 100 x 100 mm 
 Symbol (trefoil): Black 
 Background : White

Name : Radioactive 
 Cargo IMP Code : RRY 
 Minimum dimensions : 100 x 100 mm 
 Symbol (trefoil) : Black 
 Background : Top half yellow with white border, bottom half white

Name : Radioactive 
 Cargo IMP Code : RRY 
 Minimum dimensions : 100 x 100 mm 
 Symbol (trefoil) : Black 
 Background : Top half yellow with white border, bottom half white
Minimum dimensions : 100 x 100 mm \n Text (Mandatory): "FISSILE" in black on white in upper half of label \n

Name : Corrosive 
 Cargo IMP Code : RCM 
 Minimum Dimensions ; 100 x 100 mm 
 Symbol (liquids spilling from two glass vessels and attacking a hand and metal) : Black 
 Background : Upper half white, lower half black with white border

Name : Miscellaneous 
 Cargo IMP Code : RMD or ICE, RLI, RLM, RSB 
 Minimum Dimensions : 100 x 100 m 
 Symbol : seven vertical stripes in upper half : Black 
 Background : White

Name : Magnetized Material 
 Cargo IMP Code : MAG 
 Minimum Dimensions : 110 x 90 mm 
 Color : Blue on White

Name : This Way Up 
 Minimum Dimensions : 74 x 105 mm 
 Color : Red or Black on a contrasting background

Name : Lithium Battery Label 
 Cargo IMP Code : RLI, RLM, ELI 
 Dimensions : 105 x 75 mm 
 Color : the border on the label must have red diagonal hatchings. Text and symbol black on a contrasting background

Name : Keep away from heat 
 Dimensions : 74 x 105 mm 
 Color : Red and black on a white background or alternative colors

Name : Cargo Aircraft Only 
 Cargo IMP Code : CAO 
 Dimensions : 120 x110 mm 
 Color : Black on Orangen

Name : Cyrogenic Liquid 
 Cargo IMP Code : RCL 
 Minimum Dimensions : 75 x 105 mm 
 Color : White on Green

Packages containing dangerous goods which may react dangerously with each other, must not be stowed on a aircraft next to each other on in position that allow interaction between them in the event of leakage. To maintain acceptable segregation between packages containing dangerous goods having different hazards, the segregation requirement shown on table below must be observed.

Notes : 

 				 1. An "x" at the intersection of a row and a column indicates that packages containing these classes/divisions of dangerous goods must be segregated. A "—" at the intersection of a row and column indicates that packages containing these classes/divisions of dangerous goods do not require segregations. 

 				 2. divisions 1.4 S , 4.1, and Class 6, 7, and 9 are not included on the table as they do not require segregation from other classes of dangerous goods.
Packing Instructionn 219
Packing Instructionn 101
Packaging Instruction Y956
Packing Instruction 114
Packaging Instruction Y964

STATE VARIATION: AEG-09, BEG-02, BHG-02/03, CAG-12, DQG-02, EGG-01, GBG-01, HKG-03, ITG-05, KGG-02, MYG-03, SAG-04, USG-05/15, ZAG-01 


OPERATOR VARIATIONS: 5X-02/04, AH-02, AI-01, AM-01, BR-03, BZ-01, CA-11, D0-04, D5-01, ES-04, FX-01, GF-01/02, IG-01, IJ-01, IR-04, JJ-01, JU-02,KL-01, LY-04, MD-04, MH-11, MK-03, OU-11, PL-01, PR-01, PZ-01, QY-04, SQ-01, TU-01, UL-03, V3-01, VN-05, WY-02, XK-01 


Packagings as specified by the appropriate national authority. 

The following statement must be marked on the Shipper’s Declaration for Dangerous Goods: “Packaging approved by the competent authority of XXX”, where “XXX” is the International Vehicle Registration Code (VRI Code) of the country which the authority acts. 


Note: 

In this the team “competent authority” is used for the intermodal compatibility; it refers to the appropriate national authority.

STATE VARIATION: USG-04 


OPERATOR VARIATIONS: AM-09, DE-01, FX-06, GA-03, GF-04, IJ-12, KC-11, LH-01, LX-02, MH-14, OS-03, OU-04, PX-10, SW-02, TN-04, UX-02, VO-03, VT-01, WY-04, XG-01, XK-03, XQ-01 


This instruction applies to Limited Quantities of UN 3077 and UN 3335. 


The General Packing Requirements of Subsection 2.7.5, 5.0.2 to 5.0.4 (with the exception of 5.0.2.3, 5.0.2.5, 5.0.2.11 and 5.0.2.14.2) must be met except that the packagings do not have to meet the marking and testing requirements of 6.0.4 and Subsection 6.3. Packagings must meet the construction criteria specified in Subsection 6.1 and 6.2 and the test criteria specified in Subsection 6.6. 


Compatibility Requirements 
 		 - Substances must be compatible with their packagings as required by 5.0.2.6. 


Closure Requirements 

		 - Closures must meet the requirements of 5.0.2.7. 


Limited Quantity Requirements 


The requirements of Subsection 2.7 must be met including: 

		 - the capability of the package to pass a drop test of 1.2 m; 
 		 - a 24 hour stacking test; 
 		 - the gross weight of the completed package must not exceed 30 kg. 


Single packagings are not permitted.

STATE VARIATION: AEG-09, BEG-02,BHG-02/03, CAG-12, DQG-02, EGG-01, GBG-01, HKG-03, ITG-05, KGG-02, MYG-03, SAG-04, USG-05/13, ZAG-01 


OPERATOR VARIATIONS: 5X-02/04, AH-02, AI-01, AM-01, BR-03, BZ-01, CA-11, D0-04, D5-01, ES-04, FX-01, GF-01/02, IG-01, IJ-01, IR-04, JJ-01, JU-02, KL-01, LY-04, MD-04, MH-11, MK-03, OU-11, PL-01, PR-01, PZ-01, QY-04, SQ-01, TU-01, UL-03, V3-01, VN-05, WY-02, XK-01 


This instruction applies to UN 0407, UN 0448, and UN 0509 on Cargo Aircraft Only. 

The General Packing Requirements of Subsection 5.0.2, 5.1.0 and 5.1.1 must be met. 

Unless otherwise provided for in these Regulation, packagings, must meet Packing Group II requirements. 


Wetted Solid: 

Wetted solid explosive may only be packed in accordance with this Packing Instruction under an exemption issued by the appropriated national authority of the State of origin. 


Dry Solid: 

Intermediate packagings are not required. 


Additional Packaging Requirements 

For UN 0509 metal packagings must be used.

STATE VARIATION: USG-04 


OPERATOR VARIATIONS: AM-09, DE-01, FX-06, GA-03, GF-04, IJ-12, KC-11, LH-01, LX-02, MH-14, OS-03, OU-04, PX-10, SW-02, TN-04, UX-02, VT-01, WY-04, XG-01, XK-03, XQ-01 


This instruction applies to Limited Quantities of UN 1941, UN 1990, UN 3082 and UN 3334. 


Except for UN 3082, when the requirements of 5.0.2.9 do not apply; The General Packing Requirements of Subsections 2.7.5, 5.0.2, to 5.0.4 (with the exception of 5.0.2.3, 5.0.2.5, 5.0.2.11 and 5.0.2.14.2) must be met except that the packagings do not have to meet the marking and testing requirements of 6.0.4 and Subsection 6.3. Packagings must meet the construction criteria specified in Subsection 6.1 and 6.2 and the test criteria specified in Subsection 6.6. 


Compatibility Requirements 
 		 - Substances must be compatible with their packagings as required by 5.0.2.6. 


Closure Requirements 
 		 - Closures must meet the requirements of 5.0.2.7. 


Limited Quantity Requirements 


The requirements of Subsection 2.7 must be met including: 

		 - the capability of the package to pass a drop test of 1.2 m; 
 		 - a 24 hour stacking test; 
 		 - the gross weight of the completed package must not exceed 30 kg. 


Single packagings are not permitted.

Part 110, paragraph 110.5(h) of the Peruvian Aviation Regulations currently in force states that all air shipments of explosives including loads in transit must have a written authorization or exemption issued by the DGCA, as appropriate. Paragraph 110.5(i) sets out the requirements for the granting of authorizations and exemptions.

All shipments of dangerous goods that qualify as controlled products or chemical inputs by the terms of Law 28305 on Controlled Products and Chemical Inputs of Peru must comply with the provisions of said law.

Part 110, paragraph 110.37(d) of the Peruvian Aviation Regulations currently in force states that shippers offering dangerous goods for loading onto an aircraft must provide the air operator with copies of the safety information sheets for the goods to be shipped.

In domestic transport and in international transport originating in Spain, Spanish shall be used in all the markings and in the dangerous goods transport document, in addition to the languages required by the States of transit and destination.

Consignments containing spent nuclear fuel or radioactive waste transported to, from, through or over the territory of Poland are subject to prior written notification. Notification should be forwarded at least two weeks prior to shipment to: 

 National Atomic Energy Agency (PAA) 
 Department of Radiological Protection 
 Krucza 36 Street 
 00-522 Warsaw 
 Poland 

 Telephone: +48 22 695 97 43 
 Facsimile: +48 22 695 98 71 
 Email: sekretariat.dor@paa.gov.pl

Operators intending to carry dangerous goods to, from, within and over Nepal must obtain prior written permission from the Director General, Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal. The requests for approval should be addressed to: 


Flight Safety Standards Department 
 Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal 

Singamangal, Kathmandu 

NEPAL 


Telephone: +977-1-4111075/4111119 

Facsimile: +977-1-4111198 

Email: atsc@ccsl.com.np

The exportation, importation and transit of all radioactive material, without exceptions, are subject to the approval of the State Export Control Service of Ukraine and a decision from the Environmental Safety Ministry (State Nuclear Regulatory Administration of Ukraine). Any questions regarding this variation should be addressed to: 


State Export Committee of Ukraine 
 19/21 Frunze Street 
 Kiev, 254080 
 UKRAINE 
 Telephone/facsimile: 044-4624970 

 or 


State Nuclear Regulatory Administration of Ukraine 
 9/11 Arsenaina Street 
 Kiev, 01011 
 UKRAINE 
 Telephone: 044-2944224 
 Facsimile: (044) 2948895

Petrol powered equipment, such as chainsaws, brush cutters, generators or the like, either new or used, are forbidden in carry on or checked in baggage. Such items will only be accepted as cargo if they are packaged and shipped in accordance with IATA dangerous goods regulations where special provision A70 applies to internal combustion or fuel cells engines, these items may be accepted for transport as cargo provided operator approval has been granted. \n\n
Dangerous goods listed in the list of high consequence dangerous goods will not be accepted. \n\n

Lithium ion batteries UN 3480 are prohibited for carriage as cargo. This prohibition does not apply to : 


- UN 3481 Lithium ion contained in or packed with equipment. 

- UN 3091 Lithium metal batteries in or packed with equipment. 

- Lithium batteries (rechargeable and non-rechargeable) covered by the provisions for dangerous goods carried by passenger or crew.

Dangerous goods in TNT Express Air Network (including UN 3480 and UN 3090, section 1A, 1B and II), will be accepted from approved customers only after TNT and Customer have agreed on specific dangerous goods related requirements and conditions. Contact the local TNT office for detail of this requirements as well as the application procedure for the “approved customer status”. \n\n

Lithium ion and lithium metal batteries in TNT’s General Cargo Service : 


- UN 3480 and UN 3090 of section II are strictly forbidden; 

- UN 3480 and UN 3090 of section IA and IB are subject to prior approval. A copy of the Shipper’s Declaration and the UN test report must be provided at the time of booking. 

- UN 3481 and UN 3091, all Sections are acceptable if in compliance with the IATA DGR.

Only the following dangerous goods under class 1 – explosive, division 1.4S are acceptable to Philipine Airlines for air carriage 

 UN Number –description 
 UN 0012—Cartridges for weapons, inert projectile [130] 
 UN 0012—Cartridges small arms [130] 
 UN 0014 – Cartridges for weapons, blank [130] 
 UN 0014—Cartridges small arms, blank [130] 
 UN 0044—Primers, cap type [133] 
 UN 0055—Cases, cartridges , empty, with primer [136] 
 UN 0405—Cartridges, signal [135]
Fuel containers for camping stoves that have contained a flammable liquid fuel shall not be accepted for carriage as checked baggage \n\n
UN 3480—Lithium ion batteries, PI 965 section IA, section IB, section II will not be accepted for carriage as cargo \n\n
Not Used. \n\n

Division 4.1 Flammable Solids. Passengers and crew are not permitted to bring book matches onto aircraft for personal use. Book matches are only allowed as correctly packed and declared dangerous goods consignment (see 2.3.5.6) \n\n
Operator approval is required for the carriage of all new and used internal combustion engines (see.2.3.5.15) \n\n
Oxygen or air, gaseous cylinders required for medical use are only accepted for transport in or as carryon baggage (see 2.3.4.1) \n\n

Dangerous Goods in consolidation will not be accepted for carriage except for UN 1845 Carbon dioxide solid/dry ice up to maximum of 145 kg per flight when used as refrigerant for non-dangerous goods consignment. \n\n
Dangerous goods as defined in these regulations will not be accepted in air mail. \n\n
Not Used. \n\n
Fissile radioactive material will not be accepted for carriage. \n\n
Liquid dangerous goods packed in single metal packagings (1A1, 1A2, 1B1, 1B2) will not be accepted unless safety overpacked to protect the base of the packaging. \n\n

Small oxygen cylinders containing gaseous oxygen or air required for medical use are not permitted on the person, in checked or carry on baggage. Czech Airlines provide oxygen cylinders on request of passenger during flight booking, but at least 48 hours in advance. \n\n
